title: Operator Daily Maintenance of Crawler Tractors

tasks.task: Conducting daily pre-start checks on a crawler tractor
subtasks: Inspect tracks for wear at sprocket teeth, pins and bushings, and rollers
Examine crawlers and attachments for damage or wear, including dozer blade, push frame, cutting edges, and end bits
Check for fluid leaks in tracks, hydraulic hoses, blade angle/cylinder seals, and engine compartments
Verify fluid levels in engine coolant, engine oil via dipstick, and hydraulic oil via sight gauge; add fluid if necessary
Drain fuel tank condensation and sediment; check battery condition, including tightening cables and adding water if needed
Review machine's hour meter and perform fuel tank fill-up if necessary
Inspect and clean the engine air filter system (pre-cleaner, air cleaner elements)
Listen for engine noises and check all gauges (amp, oil pressure, hydraulic pressure, fuel gauge, temp, etc.)
Operate dozer and ripper attachments through their full range of motion
Test the steering system and brakes
Monitor equipment performance and read gauges during work
Adjust track tension as needed to prevent excessive wear or looseness
Park the tractor on a level surface, lower attachments, and set the parking brake
Idle the engine for five minutes before shutdown
Record hour meter reading and fill the fuel tank if low
Lubricate all mechanical joints as per manufacturer's guidelines
Remove debris from tracks, dozer blade, and other equipment surfaces
